poem:
Title: Flight of the Non-Doms

In the taxmen's dawn, the coffers cry,
Where velvet wallets seek foreign sky.
In golden jets, they swiftly fly, 
The gilded, "petrified" non-dom guy.
Fearing Labour's plan, their dreams awry,
To 'plain old folk' no goodbye sigh.
Non-dom heartbeats stutter, with sigh,
In the accountancy firm's looming eye. 
Gone - yet their absence, no cause for high.
